description: An anime adaptation of Bandai's digital card game "Majin Bone".

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

name.native: レボルト/ダークケルベロス
タイガー・ヴィクトール

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEBU_KURO)

He was once the assistant and apprentice of Takeshi Obata of _Hikaru no Go_ and _Death Note_ fame. He had a number of one-shots published in Weekly Shonen Jump, namely _Partner_ (won the 122nd Hop*Step award), _Samui Hanashi_ (won the 2nd Prize in the 51st Akatsuka Award), _Kaitou COLT_, and of course, _Eyeshield 21_ (began serialization in Weekly Shonen Jump No. 34 2002).

He is also responsible for designing Dust Man from _Rockman 4_ and Crystal Man from _Rockman 5_.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/@tanusuke45) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kōnosuke_Uda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宇田鋼之介)

He graduated from the Animation Department of Tokyo Design Academy and worked as a freelancer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). He currently works mainly for [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Website (Hedworks)](http://hedworks.sakura.ne.jp/info.html) | [Twitter (Hedworks)](https://twitter.com/hed_works)

The president of Hedworks, a company that produces background art for anime and games.

_Note: Not to be confused with either of the two animators, [佐藤雅弘](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and [佐藤正博](https://anilist.co/staff/222513/)._

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cocoa2448)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/takatsuguw)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIHIFDHvA6loFvr1GwxCITA/videos)__

__Birthplace:__ Sakura City, Chiba Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Meguro City, Tokyo, Japan

__Takatsugu Wakabayashi__ is a Japanese composer and arranger, who mainly composes music for the game industry.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEBU_KURO)

He was once the assistant and apprentice of Takeshi Obata of _Hikaru no Go_ and _Death Note_ fame. He had a number of one-shots published in Weekly Shonen Jump, namely _Partner_ (won the 122nd Hop*Step award), _Samui Hanashi_ (won the 2nd Prize in the 51st Akatsuka Award), _Kaitou COLT_, and of course, _Eyeshield 21_ (began serialization in Weekly Shonen Jump No. 34 2002).

He is also responsible for designing Dust Man from _Rockman 4_ and Crystal Man from _Rockman 5_.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jun_emu_)

Longtime member of [Yuusuke Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/96903)'s staff. Specializes in effects.
